document_data.name: Derro
document_data.first: [[Wikipedia:The Lost Caverns of Tsojcanth|''The Lost Caverns of Tsojcanth'']]
document_data.Description: Derro appeared to resemble small [[dwarves]]. They had blue-gray skin, and their hair was often white, yellow, or pale tan in color. They lacked both irises and pupils, showing uniformly pale eyes. Most derro looked haggard and wore shabby clothing, appearing pitiable to unsuspecting victims.
document_data.Biology:
The eyes of these creatures were capable of seeing in [[Darkvision|total darkness]] as well as the [[Ultravision|ultraviolet spectrum]] out to a range of {{SI|120|ft|long=yes}}. They often suffered nausea while in sunlight.

Their bodies were typically quite dexterous.
document_data.Combat: Derro were typically known to wield [[crossbow|repeating light crossbows]] with [[poison]]-laced [[arrow]]s, hooked [[fauchard]]s, [[dagger]]s, [[spear]]s, and [[aklys]].

Society.Homelands:
Derro were widespread, likely to be found in and throughout the Underdark. Some had colonies beneath the [[Savage North]]. There were also derro warrens within duergar cities, like [[Gracklstugh]], but such derro were treated as a disrespected underclass.<ref>

Beyond [[Toril]], derro could be found on a number of worlds due to magical travel, including [[Oerth]]. The world of [[Krynn]] was one not known to have any true instances of derro on it, though one of Krynn's endemic dwarven subraces was noted as being rather similar.{{Cite dragon/241/Legacies of the Suel Imperium|41}}
Society.Religion: Most derro revered the god [[Diirinka]], but very few became actual [[cleric]]s. Instead, Diirinka's blessing was considered manifest in the sorcery of their many savants.

document_data.Notable Derro:
* [[Buppido]], a cunning and insane killer who believed himself to be the incarnation of the derro god [[Diinkarazan]].<ref name=OotA-p6">
* [[Droki]], a courier who worked for the [[Grey Ghost]] thieves' guild in Gracklstugh.
